{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3695281,"name":"Amit sucher","username":"AmitSucher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amitsucher/{size}/257401_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-31T13:30:23.749Z","cooked":"

We are looking to purchase a PC for either 2000$ or 2 for $1000 each.
Does anyone have a good PC in that price range and could share the link to it / the specs of the PC?
It is mainly for CAD and maybe media stuff like video editing etc..

Location?

What CAD software?

Prebuilt or custom?

Laptop or Desktop? (Desktop needs additonal peripherals)

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-07-31T13:45:38.567Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":353,"readers_count":352,"score":170.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504845,"topic_slug":"looking-to-buy-a-2000-pc-for-cad-media-stuff","display_username":"Brendan Conover","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"washed alum|frcdesign.org"},"post_url":"/t/looking-to-buy-a-2000-pc-for-cad-media-stuff/504845/2","custom_user_title":"washed alum|frcdesign.org","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3695302,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-31T14:00:00.972Z","cooked":"

If you’re starting from scratch, I’d spend a good bit of that (around half) of that on a NAS and drives for reliable storage, a 3D mouse for CAD, and then spend only $700-950 on a mid-range PC. The PC will age out faster than the NAS and the NAS will give your media, business, and maybe coding teams some bias towards year-to-year continuity.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-07-31T14:39:01.303Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":284,"readers_count":283,"score":71.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504845,"topic_slug":"looking-to-buy-a-2000-pc-for-cad-media-stuff","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/looking-to-buy-a-2000-pc-for-cad-media-stuff/504845/6","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3695351,"name":"Adam Mller","username":"Amiller","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amiller/{size}/203648_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-31T15:05:07.401Z","cooked":"

It’s probably cheaper to build a custom PC yourself, and it will run better than most prebuilds.
Dell does make decent workstations, but they age very quickly. Onshape is the preferred software because it will run on a potato.
Hope this was helpful!
If you need help picking parts for a custom PC, I can help.

I’m not sure which prebuilts you can get across the sea, so here’s some laptops and specs for workstations I am using for CAD very often. This is really just to get an idea of what specs you need to have a good setup.

Dell Precision 5530
This is a pretty close equivalent of what I use daily for Solidworks. Handles some very large automotive-level designs unreasonably well.

Lenovo Legion Y540-15
This one is what I recommend to most people who ask about a good CAD laptop. It’s my personal laptop I’ve been using since around 2019. Handles full Inventor robot assemblies like a dream. The fans can get a little loud tho lol

For my personal PC, which I built back in 2019, I’ve been running full robot assemblies in both Solidworks and Inventor. Here’s what it has:
1070ti
i5-8600k
32gb DDR4

Hope this helps!

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-07-31T22:31:51.942Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":43.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504845,"topic_slug":"looking-to-buy-a-2000-pc-for-cad-media-stuff","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76634,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/looking-to-buy-a-2000-pc-for-cad-media-stuff/504845/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3695766,"name":"","username":"QwertyChouskie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/qwertychouskie/{size}/177994_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-31T23:14:09.423Z","cooked":"
AmitSucher:

Solidworks

Instead of throwing money at the problem, I highly suggest trying software that doesn’t need a $1000-$2000 PC. Namely, Onshape. It takes like 5 minutes to sign up; create an account and mess around with it a bit. If it works well for your use-case, great! If it doesn’t, no harm no foul.

The problem of using CAD software that requires high-power PCs and complicated setup processes is that it’s a major barrier to having more students get involved in the CAD. With Onshape, anyone that has any computer with a web browser can be doing CAD in the like 5 minutes it takes to create an account.

EDIT: And at that point, if you still need a PC for media stuff, a base model Mac Mini is actually a killer value, and I have heard that Adobe software is also more stable/reliable on macOS than Windows.

But as it is, each team differs.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-07-31T23:31:01.656Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":82.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504845,"topic_slug":"looking-to-buy-a-2000-pc-for-cad-media-stuff","display_username":"RoboGeek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54615,"username":"QwertyChouskie","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/qwertychouskie/{size}/177994_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Seeking Knowledge; Failed Programming"},"post_url":"/t/looking-to-buy-a-2000-pc-for-cad-media-stuff/504845/12","custom_user_title":"Seeking Knowledge; Failed Programming","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3695819,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-01T00:02:03.705Z","cooked":"

I don’t know any frc software that needs a $1000 pc. Including inventor/Autocad.

I have used business pcs that I picked up for $100. With a $300 - $400 video card and some extra ram, they have no problem running cad. Cad requires very little cpu. Just GPU.

I had cad team members asking if they could use the driver station laptop for cad because it was a lot nicer to use
